Tucson narrows an optic with a clearing of his throat, to get the attention=
 of everyone in the room.  

" Thank you Leo, I can explain things from her=
e.  Of course I will not be sending everyone into the fray, I only intend t=
o send those who wish to fight, onto the physical field.  Those who wish to=
 monitor the Ark, are free to do so.  We will use a method of command both =
here and at the projected site.  I for one am willing to go and look for Ro=
dimus and Cyclonus.  I will back you three   up from the sky, just in case =
an ambush does indeed follow you."

Straight Shot nods.

" Sounds fair ta m=
e.  Rattrap has a better nose for trouble than I do and Wheelie has the bes=
t field skills out of all of us."

Rattrap nods.

" That's right, and Prick=
les has some pretty fancy aim.  We can swing the recon part no problemo .  =
But like Leo said, only use it if we gotta defend ourselves and not ta thro=
w the first punch."

Tucson could already see that the three of them would =
be a good fit, just by how they expressed their views.  It made him smile.
=

" See?  It's not so bad is it?  Here you are putting your heads together i=
nstead  of against each other.  Remember, look out for yourselves and if so=
mething is way over your head, please call for help.  It isn't worth riskin=
g your lives just to try and do something on your own."

He turns to Leo Pr=
ime.

" That goes for you as well.  Don't take on more than you can handle.=
  Now, let's meet with everyone and see who wants to stay and who wishes to=
 venture out."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 27, 2=
011, at 8:38 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

o stay in

There may be
> > another power at play, here to come while we are out today=
. I nkow that if
> > we spread ourselves to thin, someone could come here a=
nd the war they couyld
> > win. There is more than we know going on, I do n=
ot like it, we do not
> > belong. I fear we may find something we do not kn=
ow, and we shall not like
> > to go."
> >
> > At this point, nodding up ove=
r and readyign to go out in the portion of the
> > grid wher ehte trio had =
been dispatched to patrol. Not so much a sense of
> > fear in him.. But hes=
itation.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "You present a good point Wheelie." LEO said, look=
ing at him with an
> appraising optic. "You speak with a greater wisdom the=
n you let on."
> There was a small smile as LEO spoke. "All of us will not =
be going,
> only some of us, you are right the Ark will need to be protecte=
d.
> 
> LEO PRIME looked over at TUSCON but continued to speak for the bene=
fit
> of all. "I do not know how many Tuscon plans to bring, but I would
> =
*suggest* leaving Legacy, Lord Elder as well as Bump. Santon can act
> as a=
 field doctor with the group going out."
> 
> There was a slight shrug, "I =
will warn you though, Santon, like many
> medics, will not take a life or e=
ven have any desire to enter combat."
>

oday.  I nkow that if<br>
